data_science_framework.scripting.file_structure_manager.create_error_less_directory(path: str, override: bool = False) → None[source]¶

Function that create a dir

Parameters

  • path – Path of the folder to create

  • override – Boolean true if user want to override

Returns

None

data_science_framework.scripting.file_structure_manager.get_dir_structure(path_root: str, subfolder_tree_height: int = None, supported_extensions: list = ['csv', 'json', 'npy', 'txt']) → dict[source]¶

Function that transform a folder tree into a python dictionnary

Parameters

  • path_root – Path root of the folder under study

  • subfolder_tree_height – Height of the subfolders parsed by the

function :param supported_extensions: Extension of the files that are transformed into objects. (supported librairies : pandas, json, numpy) :return: The path tree

data_science_framework.scripting.file_structure_manager.get_file_structure(file_path: str, supported_extensions: list = ['csv', 'json', 'npy', 'txt'], csv_delimiters=[',']) → dict[source]¶

Function that transform a path into a dictionnary

Parameters

  • file_path – Path root of the file under study

  • supported_extensions – Extension of the files that are transformed

into objects. (supported librairies : pandas, json, numpy) :param csv_delimiters: Format used to read csv file :return: The path, the object (None if not applicable)
